item.description:
It's time for the next FREE classical music concert for the fall season at the New England Conservatory of Music!

If you're looking for a way to escape the trick-or-treating, the NEC Chamber Orchestra will provide the perfect excuse! 

This year, the Chamber Orchestra is paying tribute to conductor and music patron Paul Sacher, who commissioned numerous works for Chamber Orchestra.  Tonight's program features one of Handel's famous Opus 6 Concerti Grossi--this one, Op. 6, No. 8 in C-minor--along with the much loved Tchaikovsky Serenade for Strings. The featured Sacher work is Stravinsky's Concerto in D.  (Listen to excepts below; the names in the list link to youtube performances of the works.)

A special feature of this concert will be the performance of the Tchaikovsky played from full score (as opposed to a single instrument's part) projected on laptop computers.  Each musician will have a laptop positioned on a music stand in front of him with the "page turns" operated by foot pedals. This project has been spearheaded by Nicholas Kitchen, founding first violinist of the Borromeo Quartet, who regularly performs with laptop scores and who fabricated the foot pedals for the chamber orchestra musicians.

For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/nec-chamber-orchestra.

Let's meet up at 7:30pm, so the group can grab a bunch of seats together when the doors open, and then socialize before the concert.  For these concerts, we usually end up sitting in last two rows of the center floor section, in front of the railing and the sound board, as is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find, and it is relatively easy to grab a large block of seats there.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. It's also close to the Mass Ave station on the Orange line.  Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it as you walk down Huntington Ave--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Handel Concerto Grosso, No. 8  Op. 6  in C-minor
  • Stravinsky Concerto in D
  • Tchaikovsky Serenade for Strings
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xsGRglp6tvs
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group upstairs in the left-middle balcony section.
item.name: NEC Fall Concert Series: Chamber Orchestra + Handel, Stravinsky, Tchaikovsky
